channel.title: Log in class select screen
channel.description:
Well what i have done is to create a class select screen when logging in for the first time. It looks a little like the appearance creater screen but with 4 different class selections. What i was wondering was as i want to have 4 images showing the different classes, what would be the best way to do it...
The options im thinking of are to have a sprite of a player dressed as each class e.g - ranger , mage that sort of thing... But im unsure if i will need to string a few sprites together inorder to create the whole image or try to create one sprite showing it all....
Or to have a simple sprite of just the object used for each class e.g - a bow , a staff , a book for prayers and a fist or dragon axe or something for warrior....
Also is it possible to make the sprite clickable to select the class.... I think it is by defining the area of the sprite but i might be wrong?...
Any suggestions?
Thanks for looking :D

all you did was the sprite at left side, nothing more, and yes i got it working.[/quote]
by my help.

item.title: Log in class select screen
item.dc:creator: @bengina bengina
item.description:
@bengina wrote:

I have it set up with text atm and have the area where the sprites will be above the text and a clickable button below the text that is working fine(selects the class and exits to the appearance screen)… its just the implimenting the sprites into the ui… And which type of sprites to use, then making the sprites clickable…

Thanks for looking

Read full topic

item.title: Log in class select screen
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

You would have to create some new packets but the actual UI of it could easily be done. It could either be like clickable sprites or text which would then switch through the sprites depending on which you click.

Just see how the other part is done.

Read full topic
